wikipedia_page.main: Agnes Agnew Hardie (née Pettigrew; 6 September 1874 – 24 March 1951) was a British Labour politician.

response: Keir Hardie's younger half-brothers David Hardie, George Hardie and sister-in-law Agnes Hardie all became Labour Party Members of Parliament after his death. His daughter Nan Hardie and her husband Emrys Hughes both became Provost of Cumnock; Hughes also became Labour Member of Parliament for South Ayrshire in 1946.

link_mentions.page: List of political families in the United Kingdom
response: *** Agnes Hardie, Labour MP; spouse of George
* Agnes Hardie succeeded George Hardie in Glasgow Springburn, 1937 by-election

Hardie was re-elected with a large majority at the 1935 general election, and died in office two years later, aged 63. He was succeeded by his wife, Agnes Hardie, who became Glasgow's first female MP and the fifth ever Scottish woman to become an MP.
It was caused by the death of George Hardie.  It was won by his widow Agnes Hardie.
